In a message dated 4/13/2005 11:01:25 A.M. Central Daylight Time,  
jdz@... writes:

when I  finally obtained a copy of the 5th Haynes Auction Catalogue from the  
1980s.  Mr. Haynes listed an almost identical tsuba, I would say clearly  
from the same hand, stating that these were symbols of the battles between  
Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin.  So I was trying to pursue that lead.  




I fail to see the connection but then Haynes is Haynes..........
if there's an " animal connection ", then it should be a tree and a bird (  
woodpecker ? ). Recall that battle when the Takada  diverted part of the  army 
to sneak attack the castle where Uesugi was holding up ? Except when they  
arrived, the Uesugi already left in the fog, crossed the river and attack the  
Takada base camp. Same battle as Shingen blocked Kenshin's sword with his war  
fan.
 
milt
